issue.title: Printing a Dilithium3 key file results in an incomplete output, omitting the last 4 bytes of the keys.
issue.body:
When printing out the `Dilithium3` key file using the `openssl pkey -text -in sample.key` command, the output text omits the last 4 bytes from both **private** and **public** keys. These bytes are valid and should be printed. The following reproduction steps will show the presence of the missing bytes in the DER key file.

Note that a Dilithium3 key file contains both public and private keys, and so the `pkey -text` command fails to print the last 4 bytes for ***both***.

**To Reproduce**
```shell
# Generate cert and key.
openssl req -x509 -new -newkey dilithium3 -keyout sample.key -out sample.crt -nodes -subj "/CN=sample"
# The output from this command is missing the last 4 bytes from both the public key and secret key, totaling 8 bytes.
openssl pkey -text -in sample.key
# Convert the key file to DER.
openssl pkey -in sample.key -outform DER -out sample.key.der
# Print the DER file.
xxd -i sample.key.der
```   
 

**Expected behavior**  

Below is the end of the sample output from the `openssl pkey -text -in sample.key` command:

```text
...
    53:a3:bf:dd:bd:4a:4d:ad:8b:43:7c:a2:1b:7f:51:
    db:19:69:45:2c:5d:cd:12:d9:a8:a4:3c:61:42:c7:
    84:6c:b1:fa:5f:0a:7c:34:f1:45:84:81:d2
```

Compare it to the `sample.key.der`:

```text
...                                         0x53, 0xa3, 0xbf, 0xdd, 0xbd,
  0x4a, 0x4d, 0xad, 0x8b, 0x43, 0x7c, 0xa2, 0x1b, 0x7f, 0x51, 0xdb, 0x19,
  0x69, 0x45, 0x2c, 0x5d, 0xcd, 0x12, 0xd9, 0xa8, 0xa4, 0x3c, 0x61, 0x42,
  0xc7, 0x84, 0x6c, 0xb1, 0xfa, 0x5f, 0x0a, 0x7c, 0x34, 0xf1, 0x45, 0x84,
  0x81, 0xd2, 0xd5, 0x36, 0x09, 0xf8
...
```

Note the last missing bytes: `0xd5, 0x36, 0x09, 0xf8`. So expecting the following output:
```text
...
    53:a3:bf:dd:bd:4a:4d:ad:8b:43:7c:a2:1b:7f:51:
    db:19:69:45:2c:5d:cd:12:d9:a8:a4:3c:61:42:c7:
    84:6c:b1:fa:5f:0a:7c:34:f1:45:84:81:d2:d5:36:09:f8
```

`The same issue occurs for the other key in this file.`


**Environment:**
 - OS: MacOS 10.15.7
```shell
➜ openssl version
OpenSSL 3.1.2 1 Aug 2023 (Library: OpenSSL 3.1.2 1 Aug 2023)
➜ openssl list -providers
Providers:
  default
    name: OpenSSL Default Provider
    version: 3.1.2
    status: active
  oqsprovider
    name: OpenSSL OQS Provider
    version: 0.5.2-dev
    status: active

```

issue.title: Review all code for proper use of "numkeys" struct for hybrid keys
SPHINCS+ interop with BC
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The current SPHINCS+ implementation doesn't interop with Bouncy Castle under the [R3 format](https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates/tree/master#zip-format-r3) used the PQC Certificates project of IETF hackathons. oqs-provider is unable to verify self-signed certificates produced by Bouncy Castle. This occurs despite the OIDs in [Bouncy Castle](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/blob/e007cbe82622e2f3d2ba0c46cceab7d504d4cf9b/core/src/main/java/org/bouncycastle/asn1/bc/BCObjectIdentifiers.java#L157C3-L157C3) matching those in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/blob/fab30c7f4bb40898aab2a967cdd6b0f990091778/oqs-template/generate.yml#L735).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
```
git clone https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates.git
# Extract provider/bc/artifacts_certs_r3.zip to providers/bc/artifacts/
cd providers/bc/
../oqs/check_r3.sh .
```

**Expected behavior**
The script should output `Y` for each certificate signed using SPHINCS+:

```
1.3.9999.6.4.13,Y
1.3.9999.6.4.16,Y
1.3.9999.6.5.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.5.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.6.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.6.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.7.13,Y
1.3.9999.6.7.16,Y
1.3.9999.6.8.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.8.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.9.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.9.12,Y
```

**Environment:**
Docker container based on image built with [`/opensll3/Dockerfile-interop`](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/blob/main/openssl3/Dockerfile-interop) from oqs-demos. The Dockerfile was modified to build oqs-provider from the interop-test branch instead of main.

- OpenSSL: 3.2.0-alpha3-dev
- oqsprovider: 0.5.2-interop
